Fetch.summary: The global fetch() method starts the process of fetching a resource from the network, returning a promise that is fulfilled once the response is available.

remarks.para: The promise resolves to the object representing the response to your request.

A promise only rejects when a network error is encountered (which is usually when there's a permissions issue or similar).
A promise does not reject on HTTP errors (404, etc.).
Instead, a then() handler must check the and/or properties.
The fetch() method is controlled by the connect-src directive of Content Security Policy rather than the directive of the resources it's retrieving.

blockquote.para: Note: The fetch() method's parameters are identical to those of the constructor.

Fetch.returns: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves to a object.
